info.title: Realtime Market Submissions (RTMS)
info.description: The WEM-Reform API for Real-Time Market submissions available to all Market Participants.

contact.name: AEMO Real Time Market Submissions Team

get.description: Retrieves historical submissions based on various parameters. Results are paged with default page size of 500 unless specified otherwise.
get.summary: Get a list of submissions (paged). Use the query parameters to refine and apply a search criteria.

schema.description: Returns submissions made after the specified date (YYYY-MM-DD). If not set, returns submission in last 24 hours.

Returns submissions made before the specified date (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to now.
If specified, submittedTo date must be equal to or greater than submittedFrom date (limited to 30 days from submittedFrom date).

Returns submissions based on the specified type:
'standing', or 'variation', or 'invalid'*

Returns submissions based on the specified status:
'submitted', or 'rejected', or 'valid' or 'failed'

Returns existing submissions whose status has changed after the specified datetimeoffset (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss+08:00). Note that when offset is specified, the plus sign '+' must be URL encoded to '%2B'. If offset is not specified, it will be treated as +8.
Returns submissions containing the specified Facility. The Facility can be both a non-DSP and DSP Facility.

Returns submissions containing the specified Market Service:
 'energy', 'regulationRaise', 'regulationLower', 'contingencyRaise', or 'rocof'
Returns submissions containing the specified Trading Day (YYYY-MM-DD).

If TRUE, returns only VALID submissions which contain one or more Dispatch Intervals within Gate Closure.
If FALSE, returns only VALID submissions which contain no Dispatch Intervals within Gate Closure.
To return submissions with status other than VALID, hasGateClosureViolation must not be specified.
Returns submissions based on the specified referenceId. It must not exceed 100 characters.
Returns submissions made by the specified user.
(default = 500) the number of records per page. A warning message will be returned when there are more pages.
(default = 1) The page number to fetch. A warning message will be returned when there are more pages.

200.description: The resulting list of submissions that matches the query.

post.description:
Submits one RTM Submission and wait for the validation response. 
There is a timeout of 30 seconds applied to this endpoint. If the call times out before validation process is complete, a submission status of SUBMITTED is returned
post.summary:
Create a new submission by embedded the submission JSON in the request and wait for the
validation to complete (blocking call).

get.description: Retrieves the consolidated view of submissions for a specific Trading Day, Market Service and Facility. This endpoint is limited to the Energy Market Service and non-DSP Facilities.
get.summary: API endpoint that handles searching the Energy consolidated dispatch intervals using the provided search criteria.

parameters.name: TradingDay
parameters.description: Returns the consolidated view of submissions made for the specified Trading Day (YYYY-MM-DD). The Trading Day can be in the past or in the future. Future dates are limited to the Acceptance Horizon window.

parameters.name: Facility
parameters.description: Returns the consolidated view of submissions made for the specified Facility. Facility must be a non-DSP Facility

parameters.name: MarketService
parameters.description: This parameter must be set to Energy. Returns the consolidated view of submissions made for the Energy Market Service.

example2.summary: No data available for the specified parameters, or data not accessible to the participant

get.description: Retrieves a list of Dispatch Intervals submitted within Gate Closure.
get.summary:
This resource lists all the Dispatch Intervals submitted within Gate Closure. The data returned can be
queried based on criteria specified by one or more query parameters.

parameters.name: DateTimeFrom
parameters.description: Filter the Dispatch Intervals after the datetimeoffset (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss+08:00) selected submitted within Gate Closure. Defaults to 24 hours in the past. Note that when offset is specified, the plus sign '+' must be URL encoded to '%2B'. If offset is not specified, it will be treated as +8.

parameters.name: DateTimeTo
parameters.description:
Filter the Dispatch Intervals up until the datetimeoffset (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss+08:00) selected submitted within Gate Closure. Defaults to now.
If specified, dateTimeTo must be greater than dateTimeFrom (date component limited to 30 days from dateTimeFrom). Note that when offset is specified, the plus sign '+' must be URL encoded to '%2B'. If offset is not specified, it will be treated as +8.

parameters.name: Facility
parameters.description: Filters Gate Closure Violations for the specified Registered Facility.

parameters.name: MarketService
parameters.description: Filters Gate Closure Violations for the specified Market Service: 'energy', 'regulationRaise', 'regulationLower', 'contingencyRaise', 'contingencyLower', or 'rocof'

example1.summary: Parameters correctly specified and Gate Closure Violations exist

example2.summary: The specified combination of parameters return no data, or the facility does not exist, or the facility is inaccessible to the participant for all or part of the specified dates

errors.title: Bad Request
errors.detail: Datetime needs to be formatted according to ISO8601 format with time information

errors.title: Bad Request
errors.detail: 'datetimeto' must be greater than 'datetimefrom'

code.description: API or application specific warning code

title.description: Summary of the warning message. It should not change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem

detail.description: Description of the warning. Very specific to the occurrence of the problem

source.description: Contains references to the source of the warning. It may include the following Optional members

pointer.description: references the entity in the request payload that is causing the warning

parameter.description: indicates the URI query parameter that is causing the warning

anyOf.description: decimal number multipleOf 0.01. However, since this field can be MIN/MAX enum, it is being modelled as a string in this response object.

dispatchIntervalNo.description: the range of dispatch interval seperated by a dash e.g. 1-1 or 1-288 etc

consolidatedDspResponse.description: The structure that is used to send data out to external (UI/API)

dispatchIntervalNo.description: the range of dispatch interval seperated by a dash e.g. 1-1 or 1-288 etc
the range of dispatch interval seperated by a dash e.g. 1-1 or 1-288 etc

consolidatedEssResponse.description: The structure that is used to send data out to external (UI/API)

submissionCode.description: null for standing submission as it does not have submission code

gcvResponse.description: Data contract to display data to external
